attributes.action: apologise to the house of commons and the british public for taking the UK to war in iraq
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
There was massive public opposition in the UK that was ignored.
The war is illegal.
The dossier was sexed up.
Dr Kellys name was deliberately released with terrible consequences.
The prime minister lied to the house and the people to achieve his aims.
More than 130 members of the UK armed forces have lost their lives in Iraq.
Hundreds of thousands of Iraqi civilians have died.
Iraq is on the verge of civil war.
You were warned that home grown Islamic terrorism would result from going to war with Iraq.
The death of 56 Londoners and Jean-Charles de Menezes must weigh heavily on your conscience.  
Billions of pounds of UK taxpayers money has been wasted.
The UK has never been involved in such an unjust war and you have brought shame on this country.
This is your legacy.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
